Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back and reminds me of your favorite film from childhood as well as being pretentious and melancholic at the sametime. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or actual martial arts, and ultimately that's true but there's one thing you have to remember with this movie; is acted like a Schwarzenegger vehicle of old and actually succeeded wildly with its appeal of cheese,
